definition: to show one's colors/to have a clear-cut stand (idiom)
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Huang Jianxin's motion pictures are unique ones among the "Fifth Generation Directors" films.
sentences.chinese: 黃建新導演是第五代導演中旗幟鮮明的個例。

sentences.english: The United States should loudly denounce Assad and voice support his opponents.
sentences.chinese: 美國要旗幟鮮明地譴責阿薩德，並聲援反對他的人。

sentences.english: We are crystal clear in our stance against trade protectionism.
sentences.chinese: 我們旗幟鮮明地反對貿易保護義。

definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to follow through/to carry through to the end
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
